result.execSummary:
The defendant Dequrius Q Riley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 02-06-2019 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept. Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Credit for 70 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

NO contact with the victim VERONICA M-M OR 424 N 29th Street and 814 S 29th Street, Milwaukee, WI without prior court/agent approval. Any violation may result in additional charges.

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement. Upon successful completion of the sentence, Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law OR CONTACT WITH THE VICTIM/ADDRESS named above, upon submission of motion, WITHIN ONE YEAR. EXPUNGEMENT IS NOT CONTIGENT UPON PAYMENT OF COSTS OR FEES.
Consecutive to: any sentence

records.addlTxt: Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement. Upon successful completion of the sentence, Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law OR CONTACT WITH THE VICTIM/ADDRESS named above, upon submission of motion, WITHIN ONE YEAR. EXPUNGEMENT IS NOT CONTIGENT UPON PAYMENT OF COSTS OR FEES.

Defendant Dequrius Q Riley in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

State moved to REVOKE the DPA.  Defense and Defendant conceded that there is a FACTUAL basis for the REVOCATION.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.
 
On motion of the state, the court amended the charge to Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.20(1)(a), a class A Misdemeanor.   Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

Court sentenced defendant to serve SEVENTY (70) DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for SEVENTY (70) days served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

OTHER CONDITIONS:

* No contact with the victim VERONICA M-M. OR 424 N 29th Street and 814 S 29th Street, Milwaukee WI without prior court/agent approval.  Any violation may result in additional charges.	
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Court ordered defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges by 02-06-2019 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law OR CONTACT WITH THE VICTIM/ADDRESS named above, upon submission of motion.  WITHIN ONE YEAR.  EXPUNGEMENT IS NOT CONTINGENT UPON PAYMENT OF COSTS OR FEES.

Defendant Dequrius Q Riley in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense advised that Defendant is running late.  Defense advised that in order to complete the DPA the State will need Victim notification.  State advised that they were going to revoke and resolve the case today.  State advised that they will be REVOKING and changing the recommendation.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for February 6, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Apology.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Dequrius Q Riley in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Conference proceeded on the Record.  State moved to adjourn pending response from DDA Altenburg.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court encouraged Defendant to complete the terms of the DPA.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  COURT CONTINUED TO TAKE THE STATE'S MOTION TO REVOKE UNDER ADVISEMENT AT THIS TIME.  Review hearing scheduled for January 10, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dequrius Q Riley in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Prior to matter being called on the Record,  case was Staffed in Chambers.  Conference proceeded on the Record.  COURT CONTINUED TO TAKE THE MOTION TO REVOKE UNDER ADVISEMENT AT THIS TIME.  Defendant has completed Community Service but has NOT provided documentation.  Defendant's other matter to be resolved by 12-08-2016.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Status.  Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Filed, sdg.

Defendant Dequrius Q Riley in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense advised that he has requested from DDA Altenburg that the DPA not be REVOKED.  Defense has not had a response as of this hearing.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Defense did concede that there is a factual basis for the contract to be REVOKED.  Defense is waiting on the State for a response.  State CONTINUED their motion to REVOKE.  Court CONTINUED to take the Motion to REVOKE under ADVISEMENT at this time.  Court went off the Record to Staff matter in Chambers.  Hearing continued on the Record.  State OPPOSED the Defense's Motion to modify Bail.  Court MODIFIED Bail to $500.00 PR BOND.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Status.  Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl Everett Smith in court, defendant Dequrius Q Riley not in court, in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense WAIVED the appearance of the Defendant for the purposes of this Hearing.  Matter before the Court to address REMAND status of the Defendant.  COURT CONTINUED TO TAKE THE MOTION TO REVOKE UNDER ADVISEMENT AT THIS TIME.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Matter remains scheduled for Review on 10-03-2016 at 08:30 am.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 17, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Dequrius Q Riley in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Dequrius Q Riley in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Based upon Defendant's new charges,  State moved to REVOKE.  Defense requested that Motion be taken under advisement at this time in order to allow Defense time to converse with the DDA.  COURT TOOK THE MOTION TO REVOKE UNDER ADVISEMENT AT THIS TIME.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  DEFENDANT IS REMANDED PENDING THE NEXT DATE.  Review hearing scheduled for October 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl Everett Smith in court, defendant Dequrius Q Riley not in court, in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant has picked up new charges.  State moved to REVOKE.  Court took the Motion to REVOKE under ADVISEMENT at this time.  State moved for REMAND.  Defense objected and requested Bail remain the same. COUrT DID NOT MODIFY BAIL AT THIS TIME.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for July 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint DPA Discharge Summary.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Dequrius Q Riley in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Defendant has completed his GED online.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for July 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.
Review hearing scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dequrius Q Riley in court with Attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and WITHHOLDS entry of judgment of conviction into the record.

Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement received and filed.  Court orders case adjourned for review hearing.  Case adjourned for review hearing before Judge Ashley, Branch 33, per Chief Judge Directive.
